page.title: 08 Town Hill Farm.
page.content: Town Hill farm , where I live, is one of seven farms owned W.N.Chick & sons.Four people work on the farm, not including my dad who manages five farms. Our farm has sheep, oats, barley, corn, wheat and cows. The cows give their milk to calves and are not milked commercially. We grow grass for silage. This is rotted grass which cattle relish. March and April is lambing time. The sheep are brought into a large barn. Some have singles and twins and some have triplets and occasionally the sheep have quadruplets. A record has to be kept on the lambing. Cereal stalks go to make straw for bedding. Hay is used for food all year round.
